author: Richard Barley
title: It’s Too Early to Give Up on Emerging Markets
text:
The lesson that central-bank credibility is hugely valuable has just had another reading in Turkey and Argentina. But with many other emerging countries looking more reliable, that is something that should reassure jittery investors in the face of a less-friendly global backdrop.
Turkey’s emergency rate increase Wednesday only briefly stemmed pressure on the lira: it fell 3% against the dollar Thursday. Serious damage has already been done by fears that monetary policy will come under closer control from President Recep Tayyip...
